column1: Write a JUnit test method for the Java method described below. The test method should have proper and relevant assert statements and avoid repetition of assert statements.

Write a JUnit test method for the Java method described below. The test method should have proper and relevant assert statements and avoid repetition of assert statements. @Test public void testName() { /*assertEquals(expectedResult, actualResult); assertTrue(someCondition); assertFalse(someCondition); */} Class: StackedAreaRenderer, Method: getRenderAsPercentages Description: /** * Returns true if the renderer displays each item value as * a percentage (so that the stacked areas add to 100%), and * false otherwise. * * @return A boolean. * * @since 1.0.3 */

Write a JUnit test method for the Java method described below. The test method should have proper and relevant assert statements and avoid repetition of assert statements.
@Test public void testName() { /*assertEquals(expectedResult, actualResult); assertTrue(someCondition); assertFalse(someCondition); */}
Class: StackedAreaRenderer, Method: setRenderAsPercentages
Description: /**
* Sets the flag that controls whether the renderer displays each item
* value as a percentage (so that the stacked areas add to 100%), and sends
* a {@link RendererChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
*
* @param asPercentages  the flag.
*
* @since 1.0.3
*/

Write a JUnit test method for the Java method described below. The test method should have proper and relevant assert statements and avoid repetition of assert statements. @Test public void testName() { /*assertEquals(expectedResult, actualResult); assertTrue(someCondition); assertFalse(someCondition); */} Class: StackedAreaRenderer, Method: getPassCount Description: /** * Returns the number of passes (2) required by this renderer. * The first pass is used to draw the bars, the second pass is used to * draw the item labels (if visible). * * @return The number of passes required by the renderer. */

Write a JUnit test method for the Java method described below. The test method should have proper and relevant assert statements and avoid repetition of assert statements. @Test public void testName() { /*assertEquals(expectedResult, actualResult); assertTrue(someCondition); assertFalse(someCondition); */} Class: StackedAreaRenderer, Method: findRangeBounds Description: /** * Returns the range of values the renderer requires to display all the * items from the specified dataset. * * @param dataset the dataset (null not permitted). * * @return The range (or null if the dataset is empty). */

Write a JUnit test method for the Java method described below. The test method should have proper and relevant assert statements and avoid repetition of assert statements.
@Test public void testName() { /*assertEquals(expectedResult, actualResult); assertTrue(someCondition); assertFalse(someCondition); */}
Class: StackedAreaRenderer, Method: drawItem
Description: /**
* Draw a single data item.
*
* @param g2  the graphics device.
* @param state  the renderer state.
* @param dataArea  the data plot area.
* @param plot  the plot.
* @param domainAxis  the domain axis.
* @param rangeAxis  the range axis.
* @param dataset  the data.
* @param row  the row index (zero-based).
* @param column  the column index (zero-based).
* @param pass  the pass index.
*/

The test method should have proper and relevant assert statements and avoid repetition of assert statements. @Test public void testName() { /*assertEquals(expectedResult, actualResult); assertTrue(someCondition); assertFalse(someCondition); */} Class: StackedAreaRenderer, Method: equals Description: /** * Checks this instance for equality with an arbitrary object. * * @param obj the object (null not permitted). * * @return A boolean. */
